name: Puukko Style Utility Knife
description:
Because our knives are forged by hand, they take a considerable amount of time to make, and we can no longer fulfill orders in time for the holidays. 

If you would like to order a knife, please contact us and we will get back to you with an estimated time of delivery.

This listing is for a made-to-order Scandinavian style utility knife in the style shown in the pictures. This knife is designed and hand-forged in our Timmonsville, South Carolina shop, using traditional forging techniques combined with an extensive knowledge of modern metallurgical science. This knife has the following features:

- Inspired by the Scandinavian Puukko style knife

- 3.5" Hand-forged full tang blade, 7.25" total length

- Available in either 52100 high carbon steel, or 154CM stainless high carbon steel

- Exceptionally sharp and durable

- Full tang, hand-carved handle with your choice of available locally harvested or reclaimed wood. Available wood types are shown here: http://www.redforgeworks.com/customization (When ordering please specify your top two choices)

- Blade spine is tapered for durability, balance, and style 

- Blade edge is hardened and tempered to approx. 60-62 Rockwell C hardness

- Blade is differentially tempered twice, producing a tougher blade with a higher hardness edge than a typical single temper knife of the same composition

- Blade is cryogenically frozen between tempers, increasing edge-holding ability, toughness, and stain-resistance

- Signed with the maker's signature "R" touchmark

- A custom fitted, welted leather sheath is available for an additional $60

If you would like to order a knife, please contact us and we will put your name on a waiting list with an expected time of delivery.

name: Hand Forged Damascus Bird and Trout Fillet Knife
description:
Because every Red Forgeworks knife is forged by hand, they take a considerable amount of time to make.

If you would like to order a knife, please contact us and we will put you on a waiting list and get back to you with an estimated time of delivery. We are no longer taking Christmas orders.

This hand-forged damascus fillet knife is designed to be the finest trout or sunfish fillet knife available. The 5-3/4 inch, approx. 386-layer damascus blade is composed of four types of steel: 52100, 5160, 15N20, and 203E. The average carbon content of this steel is approximately 0.75%. The blade is differentially tempered so that the body is spring tempered for flexibility, while the edge retains a high degree of hardness for edge retention. The combination of flexibility and edge retention is fairly unique for a fillet knife, as it is exceptionally difficult to temper such a long, thin blade this way. The blade also features an extremely sharp, Scandinavian inspired, single bevel, flat ground edge.

The handle wood pictured is Pacific yew reclaimed from an industrial paper roll chock block. The handle is attached with the highest quality West Systems epoxy before being hand-riveted with solid brass rivets. The handle has been finished with food safe butcher's block oil. You can choose a different type of wood to customize your knife- this link has examples of what is available: http://www.redforgeworks.com/customization. Please let us know if you'd like a different type of wood when you email us at redforgeworks@gmail.com. If no preference is made, we will make it with Pacific Yew.

This knife is also available in a 7" length and 9" length (good for Redfish, etc).

The 7" damascus fillet knife is $365 without a sheath. With sheath: $435

The 9" damascus fillet knife is $435 without a sheath. With sheath: $505

If you would like to order a knife, please contact us and let us know what you would like to order and we get back to you with an estimated time of delivery. We require a 50% deposit to join our waiting list. We will put you on a waiting list after we receive your deposit.

name: Sharpening Stones
description:
These are the stones we use to sharpen every Red Forgeworks knife. The stones are manufactured in the U.S.A. by Boride Engineered Abrasives, and we believe them to be the finest sharpening stones on the market. These stones have been carefully selected from several hundred different polishing stone options for the right amount of sharpening action at every stage, so that you can quickly sharpen even the hardest knife steels. 

As a basic set, we recommend purchasing the 150 grit coarse silicon carbide stone, the fine 320 grit stone, and the extra fine 600 grit stone. We also have intermediate grits (220 and 400) available, and although you can get by without them, they will speed up the sharpening process and reduce wear on the rest of your stones. The 900 and 1200 grit stones are excellent as razor hones (1200 grit is approx. equivalent to a Japanese #8000 stone), or if you enjoy making your knives ultra-sharp. The finest grit stones also are great to use in place of a traditional "sharpening" steel because they recenter the edge while taking off a small amount material, allowing you to maintain a perfectly sharp knife without having to go through the entire sharpening process.

All stones are 1/4"x1"x6", but other sizes are available. Please contact us for more information.

name: "The Hog Splitter"
description:
Because our knives are forged by hand, they take a considerable amount of time to make, and we can no longer fulfill orders in time for the holidays. 

This knife is basically a cross between a cleaver and a sledge hammer. This traditional butcher's tool is something of a throwback to earlier times, when butchering was performed entirely by hand. Before modern-day slaughterhouses began using band-saws and conveyor belts, butchers used these large cleavers to quarter animals into primal cuts quickly and efficiently. Old-school butchers and barbecue enthusiasts today use the hog splitter to process large game or livestock. 

The Red Forgeworks version weighs approx. 10-1/2 lbs. and has an entirely hand-forged 17-1/2" S-7 tool steel blade, with an overall length of 36". The blade is differentially tempered for excellent shock resistance and tremendous toughness, and features a North Carolina black locust handle (or your choice of wood from our selection of local hardwoods). Includes a handmade wooden blade protector. 

This knife can be made in a range of weights from 6 to 11 lbs. Please specify your preference of weight in the "note from buyer" box when ordering, or contact us and we can help determine the best size to suit your needs.

name: Hand Forged D2 Tool Steel Cleaver
description:
Because our knives are forged by hand, they take a considerable amount of time to make, and we can no longer fulfill orders in time for the holidays. 

If you would like to order this style of knife, please contact us, and we will put you on a waiting list and get back to you with an estimated time of delivery.

This custom meat cleaver is hand-forged in Timmonsville, South Carolina, by Reed Moore, using traditional hand-forging techniques combined with an exceptionally high quality modern blade steel. This is a unique cleaver because it is forged from D2 tool steel, a highly wear resistant and tough steel, which contains 1.6% carbon. D2 isn't commonly used as a material for cleavers because it is difficult to work and expensive; however, I believe it produces a superior tool (especially when forged) that will hold its edge many times longer than any other commercially available cleaver. This knife has the following features:

- 6" Hand-forged D2, semi-stainless high carbon steel blade

- Total length: 9 5/8"

- Blade thickness: 1/4"

- Weight: Approx. 16 oz.

- Exceptionally sharp and durable

- Full tang handle with hand-carved, western North Carolina locust handle

- Blade edge is hardened and tempered to approx. 60 Rockwell C hardness

- Blade is differentially tempered twice, producing a tougher blade with a higher hardness edge than a typical single temper knife of the same composition

- Blade is cryogenically frozen between tempers, increasing edge-holding ability, toughness, and stain-resistance

- Signed with the maker's signature "R" touchmark

- Includes a handmade maple blade protector

- Lifetime warranty against materials and workmanship

Please note that this listing is for a custom cleaver, which will be made to order. A range of options are available for customization including handle material, blade rocker, and weight. This listing is for an approximately 1 lb. cleaver. This style is available up to 2.5 lbs. Please contact us at redforgeworks@gmail.com for pricing information.

name: Hand Forged CPM 3V Tool Steel Professional Cleaver
description:
Because our knives are forged by hand, they take a considerable amount of time to make, and we can no longer fulfill orders in time for the holidays. 

If you would like to order a knife, please contact us, and we will put you on a waiting list and get back to you with an estimated time of delivery.

This meat and vegetable cleaver is designed and forged in Timmonsville, South Carolina, combining traditional hand forging techniques with an extensive knowledge of modern metallurgical science. 

This is a unique cleaver forged from Crucible CPM 3V tool steel, an extremely tough and highly wear resistant steel produced through the particulate metallurgy process. This process results in an exceptional quality tool steel, which, in our opinion, is one of the finest steels available for cleavers today. It produces a superior tool that will hold a tremendously sharp edge longer than other commercially available cleavers, is moderately stain-resistant, and can chop through joints and bones without thinking twice. 

Each knife is made-to-order and has the following features:

- 6" Hand forged CPM 3V, high carbon, semi-stainless steel blade, 11" total length

- Blade thickness: 3/16"

- Weight: approx. 16 oz.

- Exceptionally sharp and durable

- Full tang handle with hand-carved, brass-riveted handle (South Carolina black walnut shown)

- Blade edge is hardened and tempered to approx. 60 Rockwell C hardness

- Blade is differentially tempered three times, producing an extremely tough blade with a higher hardness edge than a typical single temper knife of the same composition

- Blade is cryogenically frozen between tempers, increasing edge-holding ability, toughness, and stain-resistance

- Signed with the maker's signature "R" touchmark

- Includes a handmade maple and walnut storage box (included) or hand stitched, fitted leather sheath (additional $65)

- Lifetime warranty against defects in materials and workmanship

If you would like to order a knife, please contact us and we will put you on a waiting list and get back to you with an estimated time of delivery.

options.name: CPM 3V Cleaver w/ Hand Stitched Leather Sheath

name: Enjoy - Geometric Wall Mounted Bottle Opener
description:
This one of a kind Hexagonal "Enjoy" bottle opener is a modern take on the traditional wall-mounted bottle opener, adding a geometric functionality to your kitchen, garage, or let's be honest, any wall you like. Caps come off cleanly, so you can pop them back on to save the rest for later. The opener is entirely forged by hand from your choice of reclaimed mild steel or reclaimed stainless steel for outdoor locations, in Timmonsville, SC, and measures approximately 2.25" x 2" x 1.25". The opener mounts with three standard 1/8" screws, which are provided. Each piece also carries the signature touchmark of the maker, Reed Moore. Beer sold separately!

Each Hexagonal bottle opener is hand-forged with a hammer and anvil, and can be personalized with stamped initials, words, or numbers for an extra fee.

name: Damascus Vegetable/ Herb Chopping Knife
description:
Because our knives are forged by hand, they take a considerable amount of time to make, and we can no longer fulfill orders in time for the holidays. 

If you would like to order a knife, please contact us and we will put you on a waiting list and get back to you with an estimated time of delivery.

This small cleaver is designed to chop herbs and dice vegetables quickly and efficiently. The knife weighs just under 8 oz. and is balanced slightly forward of center, allowing for deft handling and precise cleaving. The curve of the blade enables a smooth rolling chop action with one or two hands. 

The damascus steel blade is hand-forged in Timmonsville, South Carolina, by Reed Moore, using traditional methods combined with modern tool steels. The cleaver blade is 4.25" and contains approximately 416 layers of four types of steel: 52100, 5160, 15N20, and 203E. The average carbon content of this steel is approximately 0.75%, making it a tough, high carbon composite steel. The blade is differentially tempered so that the edge retains a high degree of hardness, while the backside of the blade is softer to absorb shock. The combination of a hard edge and soft back creates a tougher, more durable knife that should last a lifetime. 

The handle wood is Pacific yew reclaimed from an industrial paper roll chock block. The handle is attached with high quality West Systems marine-grade epoxy, before being hand riveted with solid brass rivets. The handle has been finished with food safe butcher's block oil.

If you would like to order a knife, please contact us and we will put you on a waiting list and get back to you with an estimated time of delivery.
